item.title: February 2021: Top Performers, Best Earnings Recap & My Picks Into March
item.description: Earnings Report
item.dc:creator: Francis
item.content:encoded:
Good Morning Everyone,

It was a fascinating week for the markets and technology companies.

Welcome if you are a new subscriber! Every week, I conduct comprehensive research reports on disruptive companies that have competitive advantages in their industry. I look out for companies that are rapidly compounding and have secular tailwinds behind them. We have an Investi Analyst Top-30 company list that we track, review monthly updates and analyze their earnings report.

This week, we would recap developments from the month of February and identify some potential winners for the rest of 2021.

Overview of This Friday’s Newsletter:

  1. Volatility & Market Commentary on Interest Rates

  2. February Performers

    • Top Performers; Market Neutral; Poor Performers

    • Earnings Report Summary from Q4 2020

  3. The Best Earnings Reports from February

  4. What To Expect In March

Subscribe now

1. Volatility & Market Data:

The volatility experienced this week was healthy. Stocks don’t move on a straight line-up. Market movements are healthy, however, the challenge is the severe impact on technology stocks.

Essentially, yields are going up because bond holders forecast robust economic growth in 2021, anticipated inflation due to the additional monetary stimulus and lastly, the market anticipates an interest rate hike could be much closer than previously expected.

Historically, bond yields are at an all-time low. It is likely they will keep rising in the near-term. Rising yields put selling pressure on highly-valued tech stocks. Historically, if we recall when rates were rising in the second half of 2012, throughout 2013, 2016 and 2018, technology growth stocks were underperforming. The same reoccurred in 2004, 2005 and 2006. In this environment, value always outperforms and Financial firms gain. Growth investors may need to ask tough questions.

Bottom-line, we are in a new bull market due to the economic growth expected later in 2021. The reason I am confident is the health of the markets are fine. The cheat code to know this is to evaluate the defensive assets on the market because they are usually bid up during times of fear; they include the Vix, Credit Spreads, US Dollar, Bonds/Treasuries (TLT), Consumer staples and Utilities. In January of 2020 before the big crash, all these asset classes were in the opposite direction predicting a crash was pending. Today, they are the opposite. None of them are showing any signs of weakness or extreme fear, so we are fine. Its a rotation :)

2. February Earnings Summary Chart:

Below I show all the Investi Top-30 Companies. I highlight the YTD stock performance and focused on the results for those companies that reported their quarterly earnings results. It begins with Revenue growth (an important metric that predicts future stock performance); Profitability Growth (EPS) and the % beat.

Top Performers with Earnings Report (News/Update)

  • Mohawk Group Holdings Inc (✅ 76%) : No major development or earnings. However, they announced an accretive acquisition of a leading e-Commerce essential Oil and Wellness brand and raised revenue expectations for 2021. Additional details can be found here

  • Digital Turbine (✅ 38%): Reported phenomenal earnings. The report and company details can be found within my Substack. I did a full thread analysis.

  • Fiverr ( ✅ 20%): Reported earnings showing massive revenue growth of 90%. For more analysis and information: Additional details can be read here

  • Plug Power ( ✅17%): They provided future guidance and set new revenue targets for 2021-2025 that were above the consensus of analysts. The future is still bright for this name. The negative drop in earnings below was around their billings expenses, which is one-time event.

  • Etsy (✅ 8%): Reported one of the best results! I am confident this company will be higher over the next couple of months. Check out my full analysis on the report here I did a full thread and details can be found here on

It is important to pay attention to these performers. Despite of the sell-off, most institutions and shareholders decided not to sell which bodes well for March.

Middle Ground: (News/Update)

  • Cheggs (✅ 5%): Phenomenal results. Company got caught into the tech sell-off and decline. My thread company analysis can be found here.

  • 2U Inc (🔻10%): Decent results, but got caught in the technology sell-off decline than others. I am confident about their future and additional details on my bull case are here

Worst Performers: (News/Update)

  • Palantir (🔻-10%): Great results and positive guidance for 2021 and above. The stock was affected by the IPO lock-up expiry where past shareholders sold shares and the tech-sell-offs. This is a short-term issue and I’ve been buying more shares all week because I expect a rebound. My past analysis of the company.

  • Cloudfare (🔻 -16%) Good results. They got caught in the sell-off due to their high valuation. Sequential customer addition is impressive from 5000 customers to over 10,000 new customers in a quarter. Valuation is the concern here.

  • Fastly (🔻-28%): The results were decent. However, the company is experiencing a slow-down in customer growth at the expense of Cloudfare. This is a *yellow signal* but I’m willing to watch Q2 before making a final decision.

  • Peloton (🔻-30%): Good results, with slightly “okay” guidance. Peloton also got caught in the technology sell-off due to valuations.

Most of these setbacks are temporal pull-backs for long-term investors.

The chart below shows some of February earnings report by revenue growth, but always remember the % beat above estimates is one of the ways to truly measure the quality of an earnings report and 9/10 times predicts how the stock will perform over the coming months before the next Quarter.

OUT - Excluded from Investi Top-30:

  • Overstock (-16%): Reported good results as seen above. However, the reason I will be removing them from the list is because of the weaker future revenue growth guidance and there are aspects of the business that are weak.

  • Nautilus, Inc (-31%): Company reported decent results. Weak future revenue guidance suggests the business will experience a slowdown in 2021 and the business only got a “Covid” boost from at-home-fitness. If things change in Q2, I’ll keep you all updated.

NEW - Addition into Investi Top-30:

These companies are very well managed, delivered excellent results, shown great execution and traction. I will share more information later in the month as I don;t need to go into details now.

  • ZoomInfo Technology: Great company with invaluable moats for B2B marketing and positive product reviews. Founder-Led, growing revenues over 50% YoY, profitable and posted positive future growth for 2021.

  • Upwork Inc: The freelance company is experiencing massive tailwinds from the Gig economy. The company has been increasing revenue on a sequential basis. This is a big bet on their CEO who was appointed in 2020 - She is a past McKinsey and Microsoft executive and many key product related experiences. Since her arrival, her transformation over the company in the last one year is evident in their growth. More details in the months ahead.

I am confident both companies will outperform in expectations due to their robust revenue growth. I will share more information in March.

3. Some of February’s Best Earnings Report (Positive Catalyst for March):

As mentioned earlier, one of the biggest and important lessons I have learned about stock performance after a quarterly earnings report is to not observe the year-over-year growth rates, but you want to track the future revenue guidance estimates, the % of earnings beat that was above the analyst consensus estimates and track *positive surprises* from the report that was not previously priced in. Over and over, these factors ideally provide an insight into the stock’s performance for the next 3-4 months before the next report (barring any new information).

I am sharing this list as an incentive for being subscribers. Based upon data analysis, my best bets to outperform in March & April based on Earnings, Positive Guidance and Technical indicators are the companies listed below. I am most confident about APPS, ETSY, ZI, UPWK and MWK. The chart shows the companies with some of the best earning surprises in Q4 2020 that are not within the Investi Top-30 list.

Recap of Investi Analyst - My February Research:

This is a recap of some of my research and analysis work in February incase you are interested.

  • Seeking Alpha (I became a contributing analyst recently where I provide long-form fundamental research and writing). Below are some of my articles and research so far

    • Vuzi Corporation - Vuzix Corp: A Potential Winner In The AR Race Receives Ark Invest's Confirmation.

    • Docebo Inc

    • Palantir and 2U Inc (I share below)

    • K-12 LRN Online Education Company

  • All the Business Breakdowns and Tweet Threads in February, I highlighted everything above across different links.

Bottom-line:

Overall, the market pull-back is healthy and temporal. I provided the cheat code that has worked over time to predicting the health of markets.

As bond yields (or interest rates) ticker higher over the next couple of months. We will keep having to ask the hard questions - The most innovative companies are rapidly growing faster than the value names., but will the institutions understand this today? And do we need to diversify our portfolio? I’ll leave the question open.

“IF” Int. rates reach the 2% range, I will be looking to buy less-valued, innovative companies that could help diversify my portfolio and benefit from a higher rates environment. Although, I won’t be selling any of my tech companies, just diversify. These are tough questions for investors. At the moment, we should focus on companies growing the fastest with great earnings report as provided earlier on.

Welcome to March (What to Expect):

  • More companies will be reporting quarterly earnings and I’ll be watching out for the companies with superb reports and sharing them with you. I sometimes share information quicker on Twitter here.

  • In March, I will be focused on providing research on disruptive and fast-growing FinTech & Financial services Companies. Historically, these companies benefit from a higher-rate environment. I will wrap up my research on the Innovation within Education Technology.

Let’s hope March will be nicer to everyone. Have a great weekend! 

Your Thoughts?

  • What do you think about the rise in rates? Will rates drive technology away? Do you plan to diversify? What companies are your watching?

    Thank you for reading!

    Leave a comment

    If you have not subscribed, definitely feel free to do so and share!

    Subscribe now

Share Investi Analyst Newsletter

item.title: Palantir Technologies: Ignore Gotham City and Focus on Foundry’s Untapped Potential
item.description: Company analysis and product review
item.dc:creator: Francis
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone,

This week we will revisit Palantir Technologies (we first analyzed in December) while it was cheap. We revisit it just because this week I had a high number of investors with interest and questions. However, I present a unique angle and focus upon an aspect of the business that is rarely discussed within the Investing Community. This business is worth over $500M as a standalone and holds the future for Artificial Intelligence within corporations.

Next week, we will feature another unique disruptive and fast-growing business. We will also recap the month of February for our Investi Top-30 picks companies analyzing their earnings and performance. Enjoy and have a great weekend.

—

Palantir Analysis Summary:

  • This analysis focuses on Foundry, Palantir's commercial business as I believe this is Palantir's untapped potential and holds the future for long-term returns for Investors

  • Foundry’s wide-ranging capabilities within different industries are boundless and this will continue to expand Palantir's moat within the AI Industry.

  • I discuss the unique competitive advantages, capabilities and features that distinguishes Foundry.

  • My article focuses on key takeaways from the recent demo day and earnings call to discuss implications for future growth.

Investment Summary

Everyone knows Palantir (PLTR) as primarily being a software government company that only sells their software to the US Government. There is no doubt that Gotham, Palantir's government software business is important as it generates the core of the business revenues, however, I believe investors of  Palantir should focus on the vast potential that exists within the commercial business. I expect the potential from Foundry to generate the bulk of future growth over the next few years. 

This article focuses on looking at the foundational elements and tenets of Foundry, the wide ranging use cases for the software and key takeaways from recent presentations for investors to expect moving forward. I will try best to explain everything in layman's language and try to breakdown any jargon. Pardon me.  To understand and read more about other Palantir's product like Gotham and Apollo, you can read my past analysis. 

(Source: Palantir Investor Relations) (For easy access to watch the full-demo again, review this video here.)

Foundry's Foundational Elements

The basics: We all know that Palantir builds advanced data analytics software for government and large institutions. Their software analyzes vast amount of dataset from disparate locations, decoding and making sense of trends so organizations can make better decisions. At the core for Palantir is that Foundry is used for analysis of vast amounts of data so as to give insight and drive business decisions.

The fundamental elements to how Palantir Technology products are structured into the following (think about it as a funnel) - It begins:

  • Data Integration – It starts with the foundation of the software, which is its ability to combine every form of structured and unstructured data hidden across various systems and departments of an organization.

  • Knowledge management – second, the software ensures that millions of dataset are captured, classified and codified into digital artefacts, making collective organizational knowledge accessible and organized into detailed levels so the user knows - the source, the who, the what and why etc. 

  • Search & Discovery – third, the software then ensures all of that integration of data and information can be easily found and discovered across an organization and the user can conduct analysis to drive effective decisions 

  • Collaboration – lastly, enabling the information to be accessible and shared by the appropriate users through enhanced visualization and a variety of means to enhance collaboration within an organization.

These are easily the best ways to understand and expand Palantir's software. If you want to learn about this structure I defined, I encourage listening to this video from Palantir's employee.

The Four Tenets of Foundry

(Source: Palantir Demo day)

At the core, Foundry is a data integration and management software with comprehensive tools and capabilities to automate complex dataset for simple business decision-making. It is utilized by commercial organizations to create a central operating system for their data. Most of these tenets are key takeaways from Foundry's Demo-day:

  • Ontology for Collaboration:This Ontology of information, we can think of it as a foundational data component - essentially like a dictionary or an ocean of data, concepts and subject domains of all sorts for an organization. From this ocean, you can build or take what you need for analytics or future modelling. Foundry's ontology capabilities has been improved to allow for a central data source which allows for increased collaboration across an organization or multiple industry use-cases. Additionally from this ocean, the software also enhances advanced search capabilities and no-code configuration to enable easy access to information and reporting capabilities for all types of users. 

  • Infused Advanced AI & Simulations Capabilities: Once you have a deep ontology of data, the next thing is to use this information for decision-making. Foundry is unique in that it has everything you need for Data Science and modelling libraries. Foundry has the advanced AI capabilities of answering difficult simulation questions of “What If statements” – users having the ability to run models easily to understand the outcomes of their decisions especially if these situations are completely brand new or there is a lack of past data (this is where Foundry shines). Also, the software is extremely adaptable as new information changes in real-time. This is one of the reasons why this software is used in high-pressure environments like the US Army. The simulation capabilities is a promising feature for businesses.

  • Modularity of Foundry: Modularity in the sense that a system's components and its design are made so flexible so it can be separated into functional independent parts or reconstructed often to match different software needs. You can take a piece of their software and use it as needed. This word was repeated more times than any during Demo day. The focus for Palantir is that foundry can be flexible and adaptable based on the needs of an organization. This makes foundry's software agnostic. At the heart is that the client can use Foundry to take what they need and build analytics based off their preferences (small or large).

  • Interoperability leading to scale and future mobile offerings: The last element that Palantir has focused upon is the interoperability with other applications and software from databases to other digital platforms. This is important for the scalability because it is essential that Palantir systems can ‘talk’ or 'communicate' easily with any organizations systems. This interoperability will be leading to their mobile offering which will be key for collecting and sharing data in various forms. The interoperability features with a 3rd party data's platform discussed at the Demo day, we now know was the IBM Cloud Pak System *surprise* but there will be many more other examples of how their software can be integrated with other systems in the future.

(Source: Palantir Demo day)

Industry Wide Use Cases

(Source: Palantir Demo day)

The most exciting aspect for the future of Palantir is the wide optionality and extensive use cases for the software across so many industries.  Many examples provided at Demo day or their investor relations to learn more. If I had to go through every example, it will be a long list, so I will give a high-level overview of how the software has been used across sectors. Here are few that are currently using the software:

Non-Services Sectors: These sectors are heavy asset like businesses. Palantir is helping to improve the efficiency and effective of decision-making by using their machine learning models to improve supply-chain coordination such as Rio Tinto partnership, reduce waste in the value chain, better predict future demand/raw materials and enhance operating processes in organizations that rely heavy on smooth operations. Some sectors already using the software include: Material handling and Transportation; Manufacturing; Automotive and airplane manufacturers; Airlines partnership; Oil & Gas and Renewable sectors etc. 

Services sectors: Across these sectors, the similarity I found is that they are improving decision-making by minimizing risks and improving risk management based on data, increasing automation of manual and labour- oriented processes, using AI to better help customize and personalize tailored customer solutions, helping with due diligence, advanced analytics tools for developing of news drugs as seen with their software used extensively by the FDA & NHS England to improve drug developments and tracking of Covid-19. All the existing sectors currently using the software include: Management consulting; Law firms; Insurance; System integrators; Financial institutions and banking; Healthcare and Pharmaceutical industries.

I have named over 16+ industries that are using Palantir's Foundry software. Since Foundry's launch, they have helped client realize almost $500M in cost reductions, synergies and business outcomes with many more in the future.

Competitive Edge That Makes Foundry Unique

Integration power: The ability to absorb different types of data and the broad data integration capabilities with multiple applications or systems such Windows SQL, iOS, to reduce the manual/human labour to gather such data is huge. This is one of the hardest aspect of analytics and the team has focused on building their capabilities here. The ability to integrate with disparate data sources (both structured and unstructured) to extract, make connections to drive modelling and better decision making.

The modularity and interoperability: Building on the integration piece is the ability of their software to mold to any underlying infrastructure or software regardless of organizational size or IT database. Foundry can be customized to fit new user needs beyond its past capabilities of only fitting to govt systems.  Additionally, Foundry is cloud agnostic regardless of it the company is on the edge or uses either public, private or hybrid cloud platform. 

Full-stack analytics software: Palantir's software is mostly vertically integrated from the foundational elements of analytics data-gathering all the way up to the advanced modelling and visualization for the user level. 

The intuitiveness and ease of use: The user interface level of the software is incredibly easy to use and applicable for both technical and non-technical users. It has so many drag and drop features, you'll realize this from the Demo. Most of the industry’s software caters to either groups of users and makes it easily adoptable. 

I don't want to go into a full in-depth analysis again as if you combine the Foundational and the four tenets to this competitive advantages, you will find the key differentiators for Palantir. If you want more information on another aspect of their advanced competitive advantages, read more of Seeking Alpha analysis on the parallels with Microsoft.

Financials & Execution Of Foundry So far

Below, I will highlight some key takeaways from the Commercial part of the business based the recent Q4-Earnings report and call. 

As you know already, Palantir’s 2020 Revenue was $1.093B of which 56% came from Government and 44% from Commercial clients. This revenue mix has improved from previous years by over 10%. Commercial grew by 22% Growth YoY to make up $482M. In general, this sector experienced a slow-down in 2020, as we saw 4% growth YoY in the quarter.  hey have signed lots of new commercial clients (over 21+) that were NOT RECOGNIZED YET within the revenue for the full year of 2020 (This is what also made Q4-2020 revenue look weaker than expected).  Its important to note that RPO is a key metric left out of the headlines from Q4. RPO are the Remaining performance obligations (RPO), which represents the non-cancelable contracted revenue that has not yet been recognized. Hence, we can expect more in the future.  

The US part of the business is growing the fastest as they saw 107% YoY revenue growth from US Commercial customers. This signals that the international commercial sector for the business is still largely untapped and through IBM's sales team that exist in 180+ countries, expect to hear more. 

Palantir's Customers: They finished the year recognizing a total of 125+ customers. Although, Top 20 concentration risk is decreasing by (6% YoY), those heavy weight still provide a bulk of the revenue for the company. Also, Palantir is increasing the revenue they get from existing customers from $495M in 2019 to $663M in 2020 while the average revenue per customer increased by 41% YoY to around $8M. This is a good signal overall as it means existing customers enjoy the software, are upgrading and they are successfully upselling. This is important because they do not always need to attract new customers to keep up revenue stable in the future. Overtime, I believe the customer concentration risk will reduce. Also note that the contract sizes and deals are getting bigger. 

Contribution margins are important for Palantir - It is a measure of their efficiency in selling and delivering software to customers. For the FY 2020, this number improved massively from 21% CM à 54% CM in 2020. This means they are improving the way they approach customers especially utilizing software like Apollo. There are more automatic set-ups when setting up new clients and improvement in the number of deployments necessary. This is something they focused upon in recent year years and is important for scale.

Risks To Consider

We have to also to be cautions and consider some key risks: 

Palantir's management has a lot of execution to prove with Foundry with regards to product market fit and their ability to acquire new commercial clients. We know that have started building the seeds. Also, the reputation for the reliability of Palantir's software within the US Government and military is enough credibility to attract new enterprise customers.

Brewing Competition within the Advanced Analytics sector is hot, most especially within the Commercial sector. However, I believe that competitors such as (C3.ai) and (SPLK) address different niches in analytics. They also do not have a full-stack layer and the advanced analytical integration capabilities of Foundry's. I have also outlined all the reasons I believe makes Palantir unique above that most competitors cannot match.

They have a small margin for error with customers due to the current customer concentration of the Top-20 clients. Moving forward, with the IBM partnership and expansion into the private sector, I see this customer risk reducing overtime and being minimized as they capture new customers. 

Refusal to adopt Palantir’s software and longer sales cycles: Due to the fact that the company has spent most of its years within Government sector. They may lack some experience, market-fit or not enough credibility to make their software appeal to commercial clients (relative to competitors who are strictly providers of analytical tools to private companies who already have a core competency here). They may encounter clients whose systems cannot not 'talk' with Foundry or clients with archaic systems. Palantir has realized this problem which is why on Demo day, they emphasized the interoperability and modularity of the software, it appears they have been working on this issue. However, as I mentioned, with the new launch and updates to Foundry, I see this challenge reducing overtime.

Going forward – Future growth expectations

(Source: Palantir Demo day)

Palantir and IBM Partnership: This partnership will be massive for the future of Foundry. They are partnering to help businesses easily deploy powerful AI applications to unlock business value.  Expect more as Foundry 2021 updates merges with a giant IBM Cloud Pak for Data. They will benefit from the scaling of IBM’s 2,500-person sales force across multiple countries. Also, don’t forget that Palantir since it was founded in 2003 has not had a sales team until 2018/19. Hence this bump will further drive down the Customer acquisition costs by reducing sales cycles and kick-in Foundry's potential. If you want more on the software's capabilities, read about the partnership from IBM.

Opportunity for Commercial expansion with international organizations: This is another exciting part of the future is not only their 100% growth amongst US corporations but, the growth to expect from more international partners using IBM's international presence.

The Bottom Line

I strongly believe that in 2020, Palantir was primarily focused on helping Covid clients such as the world's national governments since Covid came as a surprise. They could not focus too much on the commercial side and also consider that many businesses were not spending aggressively until businesses got clarity on the future. This is why later into the year including the IPO, we heard lots of the new agreements and sign-ups in Q4-2020.

Secondly, there were lots of revenue that will be recognized going forward based off many of those partnerships meaning this fourth quarter is a bit deceptive. For management to guide to $4B of revenue until fiscal 2025 signals great confident on the future based behind-the-scenes discussions. Most especially with a growing backlog of $2.8B in deal value, the likelihood of achieving these goals are fully possible considering they could sign such an amount in just one quarter. Moving forward, the strategy for Palantir will be the ability to sell to smaller and medium-sized customers and attract 'smaller' deals with short sales cycles such as the way Snowflake (SNOW) scales. 

Third, the best part of Foundry (and management really emphasized) is that we will see more from the commercial since they are less than <5% penetrated of the top corporations of the world. Don't forget, this is a 'relatively' new side of the business that they only started focusing upon in recent years, hence they are just beginning.

(Source: Palantir Investor Relations)

Finally, I have analyzed and provided all the competitive advantages that distinguishes Foundry from the current market competition within the Advanced Analytics and AI Sector. Palantir’s focus on flexibility, modularization and interoperability will help them in this new endeavor. There will be an upcoming demo later this year that investors will need to focus upon to learn more details - I will be providing a follow-through.

The future is bright. Can you imagine - Adding the future of Foundry's potential together with the already stable government revenues from the US Government (note that these contracts are massive). I’ll leave you to do the imagination. 

I’ll wrap up with a note from CEO, Alex Karp from the earnings call “Any case, we hope those of you on this call who are current investors stay with us; and those of you who'd prefer a more short-term focus, that you choose companies that are more appropriate for you.” This reminds me very much about Elon Musk or Amazon with Jeff Bezos in the early days of Amazon. It is about the future. 

(Source: Koyfin, Palantir Q4 Earnings Transcript)

Thanks so much for reading Palantirians!

(Source: Palantir Investor Relations)

Next week, we will feature another unique disruptive business with massive competitive advantages and recap the month of February for our Investi Top-30 picks companies. Enjoy and have a great weekend.

If you want to receive these weekly research reports, check out my past research reports performance and decide if you want to subscribe and follow on Twitter. Thank you.

Subscribe now

Feel Free to leave any thoughts, comments or opposite opinions. Happy to listen to all!

Leave a comment

Share

Share Investi Analyst Newsletter

item.title: 2U Inc: A Leader In The Online Education Disruption
item.description: This is my number one pick for a turnaround story in 2021!
item.dc:creator: Francis
item.content:encoded:
Good afternoon everyone,

Sorry I could not send this letter on the usual Thurs - Friday timeframe. They surprised with a decent earnings report on Thursday afternoon, so I decided it was important to share this company with all subscribers and pause my writing on my previous company. I wanted this one because I believe this is the most undervalued and mispriced name on the market based off their future potential.

This is a special company for me. It was the first company I ever put up on this newsletter from 2020 as I’ve followed them for very long. Personal disclosure, It become my biggest portfolio holding as I have never been more bullish (Similar to my high bullish conviction on $APPS, $PLTR, $CRWD, $ETSY). I look forward to being proven wronged. Later this week, my 4000+ page full research report on 2U will be published on Seeking Alpha. In this newsletter, I have ‘tried’ my best to shorten the research to show my thesis.

High-level Summary:

  • 2U is the industry leader emerging to capture the multi-billion dollar education technology market that is only <4% digitized.

  • 2U's Competitive dynamics are getting stronger with the pandemic while recognizing all the risks are baked into the current price which I evaluate.

  • 2U is the most undervalued and mispriced tech stock meaning you’re getting a ridiculous value at its current prices. Below, I provide full quantitative and qualitative factors.

  • *Bonus fun-fact* Ark Invest (2020’s best stock picker in the world) recognized this by making it one of her Top-10 share holdings across most of her ETF’s similar to almost a weighting she gives really high-conviction names which is rare. This is a bonus fact, not a core thesis. An observation that’s important to note before you begin reading.

Investment Thesis Summary:

2U (TWOU) is a leading online education technology company with the competitive dynamics that positions them to dominate the education industry experiencing digital transformation. The company has deep partnerships with the world's leading institutions such as the Top Ivy league schools in the US from Harvard to the University of Cambridge in Europe and many more. 2U has consistently been growing revenues compounding over a 40% growth rate over the last 3-years since their inception with above average gross-margins over 70%. 

The current tailwind of Online Education is here to stay after Covid, hence, I believe that 2U will emerge as one of the biggest beneficiaries of this trend.

My article seeks to justify this thesis by providing a company overview, competitive positioning, student growth analysis and the multi-trillion dollar market opportunity for them. Afterwards, I evaluate 2U Competitive advantages and industry moat that differentiates them from the competition, I give a full financial analysis with my rationale for a $100 PT valuation, I analyze the risks, competition and lastly, a final summary of what to expect from 2U in 2021 based off their recent earnings call.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

2U (TWOU)  is a global leader in the online education technology industry for some of the top Universities.  They build, deliver, and support digital and in-person educational offerings with their proprietary 2U-0S SaaS cloud platform. They also provide the courses and infrastructure for short courses and boot-camps.  Basically, with 2U’s platform, students can pursue their education anytime in their career, anywhere, without quitting their jobs or moving. This is shown with the fact that over 84% of 2U's clients are full-time employees.

Product lines:

The business is primarily broken down into two categories:

  • Degree Program: This encompasses all the undergraduate and graduate programs services provided to Universities. The company recently began bundling both together calling it Degree programs ((DP)) as we will refer to later in this analysis. 2U creates and manages degree programs for universities by providing the digital infrastructure that universities need to attract, enroll, educate and support students at scale. They partner and assist with marketing the programs, curriculum design and an admission team to help attract and retain qualified students.  

  • Alternative Credentials Program: This is the second aspect of the business where they provide the technology for professional certificates, boot camps, and short courses through GetSmarter and Trilogy, both subsidiaries acquired by 2U. GetSmarter helped 2U expand their short-courses to reach over 150 countries and give the company greater geographical reach. Trilogy helped expand their offerings to include skills-based training programs for professionals and adult-learners. At the end of 2020, these businesses have fully been integrated into 2U. 

Competitive Product Positioning

As you can see below, 2U is currently positioned across all aspects of the Digital learning and Education industry through those acquisitions. Example: If you are a student who decides that you do not need a University degree, but want something short-term for picking up new skills or if you are student deciding to get your full degree all the way to the Graduate segment, 2U meets all of these needs. This is one of the best competitive advantages that 2U holds against their competitors as seen below. 

 (Source: 2U)

2U University Partners:

One of 2U's solid moat is the breadth and depth of their customer partnerships across some of the most prestigious and well-funded Universities across the world from North America to Europe. I don't need to emphasize the caliber of the universities shown below as you can note:

(Source: 2U)

At the end of 2020, 2U currently had over 75+ University Partners across the world. Here is an example of a popular course/partnership provided between 2U and Harvard: Harvard Business Analytics Program. Based off the last earnings call, their largest client with the highest number of students is currently with the London School of Economics which is one of the most prestigious Universities in Europe.

Student Growth in Programs:

2U has 300,000+ registered students across all their programs. This number has increased from 215,000 in 2019 showing a growth of almost 43% YoY. Across these programs, they have over 500+ degree and course offerings. Management emphasized over the earnings call their desire to continue to expand and increase more partnerships in 2021. Key observations: Generally, we can observe that this is a business that is growing steadily throughout 2020 since 2018, but particularly they got their biggest boost in Q4 driven from the undergrad program (Covid tailwinds). 

(Source: 2U)

Industry and Market Opportunity:

Let's look at the market opportunity for 2U. The prize for this industry is massive if 2U can continue to build their moat and even capture a small slice of the market. As seen below, we are looking at a $2.5T Education Industry by 2025. Currently, one of the interesting aspects of the industry for 2U is that within this multi-trillion dollar Total Addressable Market, In the US alone, Graduate education is worth around $80B and Undergraduate education is worth around $550B. Currently, only less than 4% is digitized! 2U is only a $4B company today.

(Source: 2U)

According to HolonIQ (This is the world's leading information source on Education technology). They analyzed that in 2020, institutional education spending was just around $227B on digital. They forecast this number to grow to $404B by 2025 -- and it is still barely 5% of overall expenditure and considered by many as quite conservative. While the longer term impact of COVID-19 on education models is yet to play out, over the next few years HolonIQ expects an upswing of spending on digital infrastructure in education and greater spending over the long term in new digital models as shown below. 

(Source: HolonIQ) 

Also, its important to track Venture Capital ((VC)) Investments in the World. Generally, Venture based spending is another form of smart money. Generally, VC spending usually tells us what is happening and it precedes big market moves on the public markets as these investment are very carefully scrutinized. 

(Source: HolonIQ)

According to Venture Capital investors and HolonoIQ’s data, they see the favorable dynamics of the global education and training market as VC invested almost $16B in 2020, up from $8.2B in 2018 boosted by Covid. If 2U decides to expand their offerings in Asia or internationally as discussed on the call, this will massively expand their TAM. 

To conclude here, I believe 2U's strategy of positioning their business along all aspects of the education landscape positions them to capture market share in this massive learning and education market.

Competitive Advantages & Industry Moat:

After evaluating the market opportunity, let us evaluate how 2U is competitively positioned to capture a greater share of this market:  

  • Strength and depth of Industry Relationships and Partnerships: As mentioned earlier, 2U has partnerships with top-tier quality and well-funded (deep pocket) universities. These partnerships are contracts that last over 10-15 years furthering the strength of the relationships and increases the switching costs for these Universities especially if the program is successful. The large network of numerous partnerships increases their network effects, which then makes it easier for 2U to attract new universities and bargain better prices in the future.

  • Deep Industry Expertise within Higher Education: 2U was one of the first mover in developing online programs from way back in 2008. The company has deep expertise, knowledge and huge data about students that makes it efficient for them to set-up new programs due to technical know-how. They know what works and what doesn't. Hence, Universities may prefer to partner with 2U rather than have to spend/invest lots of money into developing a whole program from scratch. 

  • Recurring nature of Revenue Education and Degrees: For 2U's business model, the high marketing invested to attract a student 'today' especially in a degree program typically brings revenue that lasts over a 2- 4 year period, hence, there is a guarantee of future cash flow. Also, the structure of their Long-term contracts give 2U some level of revenue stability.

  • Barriers to entry: 2U's early lead in the market limits partnership opportunities for competitors due to significant set-up costs and time to create new partnerships. The more partnerships and students attracted by 2U, the stronger 2U's moat increases along with the scale of the business model making it harder for new entrants. 

  • Competitive Positioning: 2U is currently positioned well across the entire online education landscape from short-online courses to University level as discussed. The fact that 2U has strong partnerships with universities enables them to set-up more reputable short-courses that can wean weaker Massive Open Online Competitors without any.

  • The future of tuition benefits 2U: It is debatable whether Tuition will keep going up or down into the future. 2U benefits both way. If Tuition goes higher, 2U will benefit from their revenue sharing model of their programs. If online education proves to successfully drive down the cost of tuition, 2U benefits from the fact that universities will want to partner with 2U due to core competency (reasons mentioned above), hence, 2U benefits from scale of students. This is debatable and can be viewed from different angles, but I believe there is an advantage here for 2U long-term. 

Financial Analysis:

First, let’s recap by asking how does 2U make money? It is primarily driven by the number of students enrolments. The drivers are an increase in degree programs or offering with university, attracting and retention of those students. The bulk of its costs are associated with marketing and setting up a program. 

Degree Program makes up around 60% of revenue and Alternative Credential ((AC)) Programs make up around 36% (this has grown to represent an increasing share of revenue).

Revenue profile:

As seen below. Historically, the company’s 3-year compounded annual revenue growth rate hovers around 37- 40% consistently. For the full-year, 2020 revenue was $774M (35% Growth YoY). For the Quarter 4, 2020, they reported revenue of $215.3 million (32% growth YoY based on Q4). Although, growth is gradually slowing down. The organic growth has been impressive.

(Source: 2U) 

Investi Analyst 2021 Valuation: 

We know that SaaS businesses are valued on a multiple of their revenue - in most cases the projected revenue for the next 12 months ((NTM)). Below is a scatter Plot of EV (Enterprise Value) / NTM Rev Multiple vs NTM Rev Growth  for similar SaaS businesses. The charts shows how growth and revenue is correlated to valuation multiple rather than EBITDA or profitability. We observe that for 2U, using their 'modest' forecast of 20% growth in 2021, we can see that 2U is one of the most undervalued and unappreciated growth stock in this market for its potential.

My $100 Price-Target: 

If we use revenue-based multiples comparison models to value 2U after showing those two charts. 

The company gave a Full-Year 2021 Guidance where the company expects 2021 revenue between the low-high of $910M to $945M. The current consensus revenue estimate are calling for $912M.  However, during the earnings calls, we know management emphasized there is strong demand in up-skilling and more news in the undergrad segment will come. They also expect Q1-2021 will be stronger.  

My estimates are calling for a 30% revenue growth in 2021 which puts us at a modest $1.00B in sales growth for 2021. If we put a modest SaaS multiple of 10x /sales, we get a market capitalization ((MC)) of around 10-Billion MC. If we assume shareholder dilution increases by 2% to 76M shares outstanding, we get a stock price of around $130 Price Target or Forward EV/Sales of around $9.7B from today's market cap of $4B.  My Bull-Case is $200 PT if 2U multiples expand to 15x or revenue exceeds $1B which is still cheap compared to peers and not out of this world.

Risks & Competition:

Below I show the Global Open Online Market for education learning. 

Source: HoloniQ

  • Competition: Yes, there is competition. 2U's direct competitors are Pearson (PSO), Wiley (JW.A), Bisk and Academic Partnerships. (Mr Durant has extensive details on them). I will note that most of these companies are publishing companies as their foundations before they began pivoting into providing online education platforms. They had to do major acquisitions to enable them transition into this segment. 2U is far above them, both companies experienced challenges in 2020 as evidenced by their negative and low-digit revenue growth in 2020 despite Covid tailwinds meanwhile 2U kept experiencing growth north of 30%. Hence, I believe that 2U holds significant competitive advantages over each of these competitors. 

  • Indirect Competition from YouTube and Massive Open Online Courses competitors as listed above (MOOC): There are people who argue that there is intense competition from platforms such as YouTube, Edx, Coursera or corporations using Docebo (DCBO) (which I covered already here) for enterprise learning. 2U is differentiated from these companies in the sense that the certificates they offer comes accredited by a top University in most cases and 2U does have a breadth of offerings and partners that none of their competitors can match.

  • Risk that University decide to set-up programs without 2U: As I mentioned earlier, there is intense financial risk and costs required to set-up new programs by a University. Setting Zoom classes is a temporal solution as new online programs requires much more effort and logistics for its long-term success. The value proposition to universities is that 2U takes on most of those logistical costs for a percent of revenue and less risks for the universities.

  • Concerns around TWOU’s ability to scale and reach profitability: Based off my participation in the earnings call, one of the concerns that circle around is the high-cost of setting up programs. 2U has gradually settled these concerns in 2020 as shown by the improvement shown in my bottom-line analysis.

Management Team: 

A brief note here is that 2U is founder-led which is important.  Chris Paucek was a founding member of TWOU from the beginning. While he doesn’t own a significant amount right now, he still owns a decent amount of the company. I have listened on different calls and observed the team is very focused on the future. They want to capitalize on the current Covid tailwinds and they are focused on the big-prize of the massive market opportunity. 

Bonus Thesis:  *Cautionary*

This is a bonus fact, which is not a core reason to invest into 2U. However, I find it interesting that Ark Investment is one of the top majority shareholders of 2U. It is owned across three of her five - ARKK ETF portfolios. This is rare. She owns over 18% of the company's S/O, whenever she owns a company in more than three portfolios, and it is in the Top 10% of all their 200+ holdings, it means she has seen something and is extremely bullish similarly to the way she built her position into Tesla in 2018-2019. I thought I would mention this because of her incredible vision as a stock picker.

(Source: Refinitiv data)

BOTTOM-LINE: 

Finally, 2U has built a leading position in the online education market with deep partnerships with the world’s leading institutions, depth of technical know-how and competitive positioning with a balanced product portfolio across all aspects of digital learning and education. Their competitive position creates significant barrier to entry from a cost advantage perspective in the degree programs, depth of industry relationship and expertise that I believe 2U holds over competitors.

As you can see below that many organizations were not ready for the digital transformation in Education. considering 2U's deep expertise in this industry, the market opportunity is unbelievable rip in the future years ahead. According to HolonIQ research, the education industry as a sector is a digital laggard with less than 4% of overall expenditure allocated to digital, presenting a serious challenge given the scale of what’s to come. The knowledge economy and future skills require massive digital transformation, and, while it accelerated through COVID-19, there is still far to go.  

(Source: HolonIQ) 

In addition, in 2020, educational institutions spent around $227B on digital. While HolonIQ forecast this to grow to $404B by 2025, it is still barely 5% of the overall expenditure and considered by many as conservative. While the longer-term impact of COVID-19 on education models is yet to play out, over the next few years research expects an increased spending on digital infrastructure in education and in new education digital models. 

Blended Online education is simply the future. It provides flexibility, lower-cost burdens and convenience to improve career outcomes. 2U is positioned well across all areas of the education spectrum to capture greater market-share. 

I believe my Price target of > $100+ is conservative considering the massive tailwinds within this sector. I also believe TWOU deserves greater than a 10x revenue multiple for its growth profile and competitive position.

Only the patient and very long-term oriented investors will be rewarded. 2U is one of the most exciting companies disrupting the Online Education space and it will be interesting see how the next 3-5 years play out for them in the Ed. Tech market.

Thank you for reading and I look forward to hearing your thoughts!

Leave a comment

item.title: Digital Turbine: An emerging leader within mobile advertising with growth turbines 🚀
item.description: Company analysis and earnings review
item.dc:creator: Francis
item.content:encoded:
Hello Everyone,

We have a short and light business review for this week for one of the best stocks that I believe is ready to dominate a large addressable market. I wanted to keep subscribers updated.

Digital Turbine was selected as one of our best picks at the beginning of 2021. It is now up over 60% YTD based off strong results. I will provide some analysis on Digital Turbine including highlights from their financial results for the full year 2020. As the name goes, “turbine” - so is the business a real rocket engine 🚀 ready to launch higher. Let’s explore.

Company Overview - Digital Turbine.

Ticker Symbol: NASDAQ: APPS

Digital Turbine is simply a company that builds pre-loaded applications into new cell-phones. They are a platform provider for building apps, enabling content discovery and mobile digital advertising.

As the image shows below, whenever you buy a new phone, you get notifications that pops up asking if you want to download an application. Digital Turbine is the company that enables this entire process.

Below is a glance over the impact that Digital Turbine has over the mobile market:

How the product works:

Digital Turbine is the middleman between service providers and advertisers who put apps on phones. The company negotiates the rates for application placements with advertisers such as Uber, Spotify etc. If we use Lyft in this example —> Digital Turbine collects the fees/money from an app developer/advertiser —-> then remits roughly about 60% to the service providers (such as AT&T  or Verizon. In Canada, Bell or Telus) while Digital Turbine retains the rest. It is a network effect business where every advertiser or service provider Digital Turbine adds, its position in the middle is strengthened.

The image below shows rough the split amongst the three partners to enable an application appear on a phone - 1/3 goes to each provider, 1/3 to Digital Turbine and 1/3 to the OEM provider.

Check out this quick 1-minute Product overview if you want to understand the product process.

Partners:

As we have mentioned, Digital Turbine’s position is further strengthened by its network effects within the value chain. The company is an international company, so you may not recognize some of the top brands below across Europe and Asia. However, Below are some of the network providers and the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) that Digital Turbine currently has partnership agreements with at the moment.

Advertisers:

Below are some of the advertising partners that have strong partnership with Digital Turbine.

As this next image below shows, advertisers such as Lyft will prefer to pick Digital Turbine over some of the other traditional advertising methods because they know they are guaranteed a certain number of users or phone devices that the company can install into those applications for them. Digital Turbine represents many service providers, hence advertisers do not want to have to handle each of those customers individually, they can easily negotiate with Digital Turbine to make the process faster thus strengthening the competitive positioning for them.

Source for more details.

Product lines:

Digital Turbine has different product lines. I won’t go over each of them as seen above, instead I will focus on the most important ones that contributes over 70% to the bottom-line:

  • Dynamic Installs (DT): Digital Turbine’s core software platform - DT Ignite, a software that gets built into phones that are made by its partner OEMs (like Samsung) and/or deployed under its partner wireless carriers (like Verizon). Before consumers ever open those phones, Digital Turbine’s Dynamic Installs software pre-installs apps onto the phones (called Native App Preloads). Once consumers open those phones, DT’s Set Up Wizard asks consumers if they want to install various different apps. Then, once consumers operate those phones, DT’s platform leverages the user data to suggest and/or directly install apps related to the consumer’s interests. It’s basically a targeted advertising platform, for apps, pre-installed onto phones.

  • Single Tap Install - This is the company’s application that enables the user to download an application with a “just a single-tap” from any screen on their phone without having to visit the Android PlayStore application. It essentially allows app developers to integrate single tap download functionality on phones.

  • Mobile Posse Acquisition - Digital Turbine acquired Mobile Posse. MP is a media product that goes natively on a phone and includes news, weather, sports, and advertisements. This is aspect of the business that is driving future growth. It currently has over 10Million Daily-Active Users with annual recurring revenues growing over 50% YoY.

2021 Earnings Review:

Digital Turbine’s growth rates have trended from 34%, to 93% — acquisitions has boosted the business growth —> from Q3 2020 - 116% growth to Q4 2020 - 146% growth rate — extremely strong over the past year! This is a sign that consumers are spending more of their time on their phones and within applications especially on media events. Secondly, as mentioned earlier businesses are warming up to the idea of paying money to have their apps programmatically installed on user phones which is also driving growth.

  • In 2021, the company is forecasted to grow over 110%

  • In 2022, the company’s growth forecast is over 33%

As investors, we know that higher revenue and earnings growth always leads to higher stock prices.

I listened to the earning call with the CEO. I provide some takeaways from the earnings call this week including additional reasons why I am bullish on this company’s prospect moving forward.

Feel free review my earnings call review for more details here on the business —> Full Details

Risks to watch:

  • Most of Digital Turbine’s revenues come from the Dynamic Installs business. Could their be a risk of one of the OEM Partners leaving Digital Turbine soon? This is always something to think about, however the company is increasing their revenue streams. They are moving from being hardware focused to more of a software tech company providing content and tech advertising reducing reliance on the big OEM partners.

  • We will keep monitoring the Gross margins and the overall business margins

  • The risk of people uninstalling applications or not downloading those apps from their phone. However, this risk can be mitigated by consumers who don’t want to take the time to uninstall the software because of the hassle. Also, consumers might enjoy the data-driven app recommendations, just like many people actually enjoy data-driven Facebook or Google ads, while recognizing some people find it annoying.

Bottom Line & The Future:

Digital Turbine has transformed itself over the past year to a full stack - digital applications advertising tech company creating a suite of products and services to help advertisers and app developers make, market, and distribute their applications.

Growth “Turbines” -

Think about the fact that there are about 3.5 billion smartphone users on the planet Earth — Currently, over 570 million of phone users have Digital Turbine software installed on their phone! (65 million activated within 2020 Q4 despite the pandemic slowdown). In general, they have a 16% penetration considering that Apple handles their own devices.

  • At 16% penetration, there is no reason to think that this number cannot grow significantly over the next several years. Majority of the world’s population will eventually have a smartphone, meaning that the number of smartphone users globally will trends towards over 7-billion over time. The more handsets its products are on, the higher the revenue. Further, digital turbine is currently working on expanding their product and revenue mix through their mobile content business. The company was pulling in over 80% of its revenues from its Dynamic Installs business that programmatically installed apps on user phones - This past quarter, Dynamic Installs comprised less than 50% of revenue. This other 50% came from the company’s various new technology and content products, such as SingleTap.

  • Digital Turbine has been increasing their International partners and advertisers overtime. As I indicated in my earnings call details, this is becoming an increasing part of their revenue and it is going to be huge. The emerging economies of the world have the most to grow in-terms of digital devices. I expect more growth from this sector and the rollout of 5G networks

Targeted advertising where companies can return-on-investment is increasingly important and growing fast. Mobile application advertising is clearly a high value-add function, and Digital Turbine is the unrivaled leader in app advertising, with a large competitive advantage through powerful network effects. There are almost no direct competitors for this company. This is a company in its early stages with fascinating growth prospects and transformation underway.

Investi Analyst Review:-

  • Digital Turbine Earnings Details —> Link here

  • Additional reasons of the positive case for Digital Turbine —> Link here

Thank you for reading. Have a good weekend everyone! Let me know if you ever have any questions or feedback!

Feel free to subscribe to receive weekly updates on the fastest growing companies in the United States and Canada.

Subscribe now

Let me know your comments below:

Leave a comment

Share

Sources:

  • Digital Turbine Investor Relations

  • Investor Place - Digital Turbine Analysis

  • Digital Turbine - Monopoly analysis

  • Full Investor Deck —> Full Details

This article is not a research report and is not intended to serve as the basis for any investment decision. All investments involve risk and the past performance of a security or financial product does not guarantee future returns. Investors have to conduct their own research before conducting any transaction. There is always the risk of losing parts or all of your money when you invest in securities or other financial products.

item.title: January - Monthly Digest & Investi Top 30 Performance
item.description: Good Afternoon Everyone, Markets just closed. This was a fascinating week in the history of the markets! 2021 has begun with an interesting twist with the stock market trending worldwide with the Gamestop/Reddit drama. Earlier in January, there were fears surrounding the senate runoffs and the inauguration. 2021 is literally the sequel to 2020 - would you agree?
item.dc:creator: Francis
item.content:encoded:
Good Afternoon Everyone,

Markets just closed. This was a fascinating week in the history of the markets! 2021 has begun with an interesting twist with the stock market trending worldwide with the Gamestop/Reddit drama. Earlier in January, there were fears surrounding the senate runoffs and the inauguration. 2021 is literally the sequel to 2020 - would you agree?

The whole Gamestop drama is giving the overall markets a pause. Major institutions are selling their stocks to take profits due to high valuations and volatility. However, the current pullback is very healthy. I am connected with some major market observers who track very important indicators that are indicative of a major pullback, so far everything says this is healthy. It is important to remember that nothing fundamentally has changed with the economy or the fundamentals for companies, in-fact many companies have reported good earning results till date helping to support high valuations. Hence, the volatility in the general markets should not shake you out.

On the Investi Analyst newsletter, we’re focused on the long-term, not two or three weeks from now. We want to find high-quality companies solving major societal challenges and who keep showing great execution for future growth.

Monthly Digest Purpose:

I plan to do this at the end of every month to keep ourselves accountable and share frequent updates with everyone on our top-30 company picks which we believe could outperform the markets in 2021.

At the end of every month, we will review the most active companies within the Top Investi Analyst Top 30 portfolio that appreciated or declined greater than 10%. We will track their performance every month with a brief commentary. I hope this update helps subscribers who are interested in looking closely at one of these companies.

As of Jan 28, last day of the month when I snapped this result, the portfolio has returned 18% even after getting affected by this week’s volatility. Below, I will discuss updates from the major players:

January Performance – YTD 18%

**As at market close Jan-28:

TOP PERFORMERS 📈:

  1. Plug Power - (PLUG) ✅ (103%):  Plug Power provides alternative energy technology, which focuses on the design, development, commercialization, and manufacturing of hydrogen and fuel cell systems used primarily for the material handling and stationary power markets with Walmart and Amazon as key clients. There are many stock catalyst that drove the out-performance this month. First, Biden’s confirmation as President and his drive for climate friendly policies means potentially more contracts for Plug over the next years. Secondly, plug power raised their revenue guidance for 2021 and 2024.  Thirdly, importantly - was that the company signed two major partnerships and received investments from a leading korean company, SK Group and the automobile company, Renault to develop hydrogen fuel cell systems designed to replace electric material in vehicles in Asia and Europe. Briefly, one of the reasons I believe in this company is only because of their “technology and access to capital” - They have many areas that need improvement. However, when hydrogen does fully actualize, Plug will be the leader but note that this will not easily play-out overnight. It will take many years with a rocky price. More news details can be found here

  2. Palantir Technologies - (PLTR) ✅ (53%) – Palantir technologies develops advanced analytics and artificial intelligence solutions for government and private companies. If you missed my deep-dive analysis, it is linked above. Investors were preparing for the much-anticipated Demo-day where Palantir would showcase their software for the first time to the world and provide a future roadmap for the company’s priorities. I plan to share my key takeaways from the event soon. Palantir has also been signing new partnerships aggressively over the last couple of months – most recently with Rio Tinto, the energy giant Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) and a new $22.5M partnership with the Japanese government. Hence, the multiple contracts signed over the past month has propelled the stock - I really like this company. More news info and details can be found here.

  3. Overstock - (OSTK) ✅ (62%): This is a fairly old company that is experiencing a transformation. Overstock operates a fast growing online shopping commercial site primarily for mostly home furnishings. They also own a tZERO Segment aspect of the business that focuses on a broker-dealer security transaction of Blockchain and bitcoin assets. The major catalyst was that Overstock announced that it would transition oversight of the Medici Ventures’ portfolio (i.e. their blockchain assets) to Pelion Venture Partners – to handle the oversight and management of these assets during a period of Bitcoin’s boom. I’ve liked OSTK as a pure-play because of their triple-digit growth in their retail eCommerce home furnishing segment, new customers added and new leadership.

  4. AcuityAds Holdings Inc - (AT.TO) ✅ (47%): - a Canadian technology company that provides digital media solutions. The company offers targeted digital media solutions enabling advertisers to connect intelligently with audiences across all digital advertising channels on video or mobile campaigns. The company was hit hard by the pandemic because of their target market focused on small businesses in the food/retail industry. However, right after the approval of vaccines - investors have begun to realize its fast-growing business and potential betting on a bright future post-pandemic as more companies shift advertising away from TV’s to intelligent devices.

  5. World Exp Realty Holdings (EXPI) ✅ (76%)- eXp World Holdings, Inc. provides cloud-based real estate brokerage services. The company facilitates buyers to search real-time property listings and sellers to list their properties through its website and provides buyers and sellers access to a network of professional, consumer-centric agents and brokers. They are one of the fastest-growing Global Real Estate Companies now in the world and benefitting from the booming housing market in North America.  The major catalyst was the announcement of a stock-split where their stock would be split into half by March to enable increased access to buying more shares. More details can be found here.

    *** Fun-fact —> EXPI stock is up over 15,000% - yes 15K! since 2016 - that is quite a remarkable return for their early investors! This stock teaches a great lesson of patience and holding on to your winners for exponential compounding returns.

POOR PERFORMERS 📉:

  1. Docebo Inc (DCBO) 🔻 (-20%): A top-learning platform for enterprises, analysis here.  They announced preliminary revenue expecting it be between $18.75M (+48% to 52% Y/Y). The biggest stock catalyst was because the CEO sold some shares and they launched a market secondary public offering of 3.65M shares on the U.S. & Canada markets to raise funds for the company. Stock offerings almost move a stock-price down temporarily. I will also add that it needed some consolidation after a 300% return in 2020. The thesis and business fundamental are still solid – in-fact they recently announced they maintained their top positioning for 2021 for the best learning platforms on the market.

  2. Dye & Durham (DND.TO)🔻 (-15%): Dye & Durham Ltd. engages in the development of software solutions for business law and real estate professionals with my earlier analysis. They completed their acquisition of a company in Australia that is highly aligned with Dye & Durham's existing product lines. Also, the acquisition means home buyers face higher costs after they recently hiked real-estate software prices by 400% - the market thought this maybe overdone. There was no major developments that would really dent the company’s future prospects.

  3. StoneCo Ltd (STNE)🔻(-12%): StoneCo engages in the provision of financial technology and e-payment solutions. STNE benefits from the multi-decade shift from cash and checks to electronic payments. The reason they were a top pick was because of the emerging market trends and the fact that they are building the Digital Payments Ecosystem of Brazil. The latest update this month was that they raised some major financing to build a credit solution for small and medium-sized businesses suffering in Brazil. It marks an important milestone for them as it enables them advance their strategic roadmap to become a full financial platform for small businesses in an underpenetrated payments market in Brazil. There no new major stock catalyst that happened during the month. The tensions in Brazil may also be playing a role.

  4. Vroom Inc (VRM)🔻 (-9%): Vroom, an ecommerce platform for used vehicles agreed to buy analytics and digital services company CarStory for about $120 million in cash and stock. No developments happening here, however, I am watching for the company’s next Q4 Earnings report to determine if its growth prospects are still intact for them to be a reliable top-pick.

  5. Goodfood Market Corp (FOOD)🔻 (-5%): The Chief Finance Officer stepped down and he was replaced with a different finance chief. There was a major shareholder response as the stock declined to a significant level. Generally in the stock market, when the Chief Financial Officer leaves their job position, it is generally looked at as a bad signal. However, there is nothing fundamentally wrong with the company as they are still benefitting from the current trends.

Best Reading Resources:

Some of the best resources I found this month to share with subscribers.

  • Ark Invest Big Ideas 2021 Released: Ark Invest is one of the most successful and top performing investment research firms in the world. I have followed Cathie Wood for a couple of years as she is an inspiration. They just published their annual top ideas for 2021. At Investi Analyst, we will be focusing more on the Virtual world, Digital Wallets and Fintech areas later this year from the report. I highly suggest checking it to find out some wildest ideas in the world of technology and innovation - Download here

Upcoming Investing Trends to Watch:

  • Based off reviewing multiple datasets and charts throughout January, I will share that some of the best Investing sectors right now are generally companies that have to with a) Home building/Renovations; b) Emerging markets (Stocks outside North America especially in China)

  • Historically, February has usually been a weak month for the stock market post-election years. Also, small market capitalization stocks may be facing pressure. This does not mean it would happen, however, just something to note in February, so you avoid taking big risks.

January Write-up Recaps:

  • We focused on highlighting the top company picks and trends to watch 2021

  • Analysis on a couple of Canadian companies

  • Goodfood Market Corp

  • Docebo LMS

Bottom-Line

We are living in historic times for the markets. There are lots of lessons to learn during this period to becoming a better investor. The market has been generally good in January, so we needed to revert slightly to the mean with the current weakness of the market. We need to remember, the economy is currently recovering and earnings are coming in strong. The market is still healthily. Know what you own in your portfolio and ensure you have enough cash to buy on additional dips. Block out all the noise from social media and news sites. Stay focused on your goals. Happy Investing!

Have a wonderful February. Thank you for reading 🧾 and have a good weekend 🍏.

Let me know your thoughts. What else I’m I missing? Feel free to provide them in the comments section. If you have any questions, reach out @odumfrancis92@gmail.com
